vaccination-history-by-pupilid.disease_description: A highly contagious viral disease causing fever and rash. Measles can spread rapidly among children and may lead to serious complications such as pneumonia, encephalitis, and even death if not treated promptly. Vaccination is the most effective way to prevent measles outbreaks in the community.

campaign.notes: Annual measles vaccination campaign for all grades.

vaccination-history-by-pupilid.disease_description: Mumps is a viral infection that primarily affects the salivary glands, causing swelling and pain. It can also lead to complications such as meningitis, hearing loss, and inflammation of the testicles or ovaries. Vaccination is crucial to control the spread of mumps, especially in school-aged children.

Rubella, also known as German measles, is a contagious viral infection best known by its distinctive red rash. While generally mild in children, rubella can cause serious birth defects if a woman is infected during pregnancy. Vaccination is the best protection against rubella and its complications.

disease.name: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR)
disease.description: A combined vaccine to protect against measles, mumps, and rubella.

campaign.notes: Ensure your child has eaten before the injection day. Bring student ID.
